subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






July 2, 2007

TOP STORIESYemen Car Bomb Blast Kills 8 
A car bomb exploded at the site of an ancient temple in Yemen's northeast province of Mareb, killing eight people and wounding
                        at least seven, police said. Six of the people killed were tourists. More...
• Jordanian Doc, 6 More Held Over U.K. Plot 
                     					| Watch• Wary Eye On Southern Plains Rivers, Creeks
                     					| Watch• Homeland Security Chief: "We Are Safe"
                     					| WatchU.S.Wary Eye On Southern Plains Rivers, Creeks
Rivers swollen by days of heavy rain are creeping dangerously upward across the Plains, even after sunshine returned to southeast
                        Kansas and southwest Missouri. Thousands have been evacuated from towns in Kansas, Missouri, Texas, and Oklahoma.  More...Watch: Floods Blamed For 12 Deaths
• Homeland Security Chief: "We Are Safe"
                     					| Watch• Wildfire Kills Three In Utah
                     					| Watch• Green Card For Missing GI's Wife• More StoriesWorldJordanian Doc, 6 More Held Over U.K. Plot 
British authorities are now holding seven people in their investigation into a triple-car bomb terror plot, including a suspect
                        who CBS News has learned is a doctor from Jordan and whose name appears on Internet postings critical of the West. More...Watch: Doctors Behind U.K. Attacks?
• Yemen Car Bomb Blast Kills 8 • 7 Afghan Police Killed By Roadside Bomb• U.S. General Points Finger At Iran• More StoriesPoliticsObama Campaign Pulls In Big Money
Sen. Barack Obama reported raising at least $32.5 million for his presidential campaign from April through June, a record
                        for a Democratic candidate. Clinton's campaign announced late Sunday that she had raised $21 million. More...Watch: Critical Week For '08 Hopefuls
• Lugar: Change In Iraq Policy Can't Wait
                     					| Watch• Bush Defends Military Buildup In Iraq• Putin Visiting Bush In Maine
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthTrans Fats Ban Begins In NYC
Sunday was the start date of New York City's first-in-the-nation ban on the fats and the requirement that restaurants post
                        calorie counts. But visits to many restaurants suggested they were in no rush to comply with the second rule.  More...Watch: Healthy Trans-Fat Substitutes
• Doctor Heads To Iraq To Counsel Troops
                     					| Watch• Poison Ivy Getting Worse, Researchers Say
                     					| Watch• England Bans Smoking In Public Places• More StoriesSciTechCooking With The Sun
Solar cookers were tried out by "America's Test Kitchen," whose host, Chris Kimball, reported on the results on The
                        Early Show. They promise delicious dishes without having to plug in a cord or light a match. More...Watch: Solar-Powered Cooking
• Space Shuttle Leaves Calif. Atop Jumbo Jet
                     					| Watch• The iPhone ... Was It Worth The Wait?
                     					| Watch• Online Gambling Moneyman Pleads Guilty• More StoriesBusinessHappier Summer Travel
Summer just started and already airline confusion is wreaking havoc on travel plans. iPhones or other high-tech devices can
                        ease boredom, and Ray Hennessey Editor of SmartMoney.com, has some more tips for a happier summer.  More...Watch: Happy Summer Travel
• Lunch With Warren Buffett? $650,100• Oil Futures Settle Above $70 A Barrel• Find Your Retirement Dream Job• More StoriesEntertainmentCriss Angel's Wife Surfaces, Wants Divorce
Illusionist Criss Angel's wife, Joanne, says the magic is gone from their marriage and has filed for divorce. Angel has recently
                        been linked with actress Cameron Diaz. More...
• Finding The Secret To Success• The ShowBuzz Weekly Forecast• Old And New Mix At Concert For Diana
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionDiversity and Equity Win Out
National Review Online says that the Supreme Court's ruling against allowing race to determine which school to place
                        a child in is a positive step forward, but the ruling still has its downfalls.  More...Watch: Reading, Writing And Race
• What Have They Done To Milk?

Floods Blamed For 12 DeathsFlooding In Texas, Missouri, and Kansas has forced the evacuation of hundreds of residents and is being blamed for at least
                                    a dozen deaths. Hari Sreenivasan reports.
